title: Customer Insights Specialist
description:
Overview:

In this role, you will lead the market research efforts to uncover actionable insights that drive strategic business planning decisions. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in market research methodologies, data analysis, and a deep understanding of consumer behavior across diverse demographics and a passion to use market insights to propel our business by empowering our teams with the knowledge they need to make more informed decisions for product sales and development and brand and marketing initiatives.


Responsibilities:
**WHAT YOU'LL GET TO DO:**

  

In this role, you will lead the market research efforts to uncover actionable insights that drive strategic business planning decisions. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in market research methodologies, data analysis, and a deep understanding of consumer behavior across diverse demographics and a passion to use market insights to propel our business by empowering our teams with the knowledge they need to make more informed decisions for product sales and development and brand and marketing initiatives.

  

Responsibilities

* Utilize emerging technologies, tools and techniques to conduct comprehensive market research to identify market trends, competitor analysis, and consumer behaviors.
* Utilize both qualitative and quantitative research methods to gather and analyze data and translate complex data sets into clear, actionable insights and recommendations for product teams and senior management through visual, creative and story-driven reporting that are easy to understand.
* Lead the development and implementation of surveys, focus groups, and customer feedback mechanisms to capture insights.
* Collaborate cross-functionally with marketing, brand experience, product development, and sales teams to align research findings with business objectives.
* Monitor industry trends and market conditions to anticipate opportunities and potential risks.
* Present findings and recommendations to stakeholders in a clear and compelling manner.
* Manage vendor relationships and ensure quality and timeliness of deliverables.
* Stay updated on emerging research trends and tools, including the use of AI in market research methods, to continuously improve research methodologies and offerings to key internal stakeholders.
* Provide insights and direction to product teams and key stakeholders globally for existing product research or consumer insight studies.
* Manage brand health tracking on a bi-annual basis, providing detailed reporting to senior management and other key stakeholders on YTD and YoY results.


Qualifications:
**WHAT YOU'LL BRING:**

* Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, Business Administration, Statistics, or related field
* 3-5 years experience in market research, customer insights, or a related analytical role.
* Strong proficiency in research methodologies, statistical analysis, and data interpretation.
* Experience with survey design, qualitative research techniques, and data visualization.
* Excellent communication and presentation skills with the ability to distill complex information into actionable insights.
* Ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously and under tight deadlines.
* Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced environment.
* Proficiency in market research tools and software (e.g., Qualtrics, NPD, Tableau) is preferred.
* Prior experience in consumer electronics, technology, or a related field is a plus.

**BENEFITS & PERKS – WHAT’S IN IT FOR YOU:**

title: Engineering Laboratory Operations Director/Facilities Manager
description:
**Position Details**
--------------------


Position Information
**About Hofstra**
Hofstra University is nationally ranked and recognized as Long Island’s largest private university located in Hempstead, N.Y. When you work at Hofstra, you join a team of talented professionals committed to preparing students for the challenges of tomorrow, in an environment that cultivates learning through the free and open exchange of ideas for the betterment of humankind. The work we do at Hofstra supports the education and well-being of our students, and the workforce of the future. While working towards this mission, employees can take advantage of many enriching experiences on campus. Whether it’s a lunchtime lecture, a Division I NCAA athletics game, a musical concert, a theatre performance, or a visit to one of our two accredited museums, there is always something exciting to do at Hofstra. Enjoy the ease of going to the fitness center, taking a swim, or grabbing a bite to eat without having to leave our beautiful campus! Hofstra University is dedicated to recruiting and retaining a highly qualified and diverse academic community of students, faculty, staff, and administrators respectful of the contributions and dignity of each of its members. We especially encourage women, people of color, members of the LGBTQ+ community, veterans, and people with disabilities to apply.
  

**Position Title** Engineering Laboratory Operations Director/Facilities Manager
  

**Position Number** 899146
  

**School/Division** School of Engineering
  

**Department**
  

**Full-Time or Part-Time** Full-Time
  

**Description**
Reporting to the Chairperson, the Engineering Laboratory Operations Director/Facilities Manager is responsible for directing the safe and efficient operation of engineering laboratories within the DeMatteis School of Engineering and Applied Science.  

  

Responsibilities include, but are not limited to:* Designs and manages approximately fifteen laboratories to optimize available spaces in engineering buildings, coordinating with the Plant department on all building reconfigurations.
* Works directly with faculty in engineering disciplines on design and incorporation into curriculum of new experiments.
* Manages the interfaces with laboratory equipment vendors and suppliers.
* Manages purchases to replenish the Materials Stock Rooms and negotiate equipment service contracts.
* Oversees equipment service calls and training sessions.
* Manages the safety training of student aides, and the tracking and reporting of this training.
* Manages the chemical and hazardous material inventory as well as the inventory and operation of the compressed Gas Shed.
* Works with the design and fabrication staff to provide training on the use of industrial power tools. Coordinates the handling and disposal of hazardous waste and the development of lab safety training programs for faculty and students with the Environmental Health and Safety Officer.
* Oversees the Engineering Media Production equipment, trains students in the use of HD, micro- and high-speed media equipment, and provides media development including media used for safety training.
* Supervises the Senior Technician in the Engineering department.
* Performs other related duties as assigned.

  

**Qualifications**
* Bachelor’s degree required, preferably in engineering or a natural science.
* Minimum 3 years of prior experience in a technical environment, preferably working within engineering laboratories in higher education.
* Knowledge and experience in incorporating and training others on OSHA requirements and standards in a laboratory setting.
* Experience with technical drawing software (such as AutoCAD) and the Microsoft 365 software suite.
* Strong oral, written, and graphical communications skills.


  

**Preferred Qualifications**
* Master’s degree preferred.
* Varied fabrication, testing, manufacturing, or maker experience.
* Experience using engineering, testing, and/or manufacturing laboratory equipment is a plus.


  

**Special Instructions**
  

**Deadline** Open Until Filled
  

**Date Posted** 08/06/2024
  

**EEO Statement**
Hofstra University is an equal opportunity employer, committed to fostering diversity in its faculty, administrative staff and student body, and encourages applications from the entire spectrum of a diverse community.
  

**Salary/Salary Range** $68,000 - $78,000
  

Additional Information
*Hofstra University provides the above salary\\* as a good faith estimate of the starting pay range which considers factors such as (but not limited to) scope and responsibilities of the position, candidate's work experience and education. In addition to the salary offered, we offer a collegial and inclusive culture, and a benefits program which includes generous paid time off, paid holidays, tuition remission for employees and eligible dependents, and a retirement plan with University contributions.*  

  

* *Salary ranges indicated for positions covered under a Collective Bargaining Agreement are in accordance with the CBA.*

title: Account Executive
description:
We are currently looking for an **Account Executive** to join our New York City team!


Responsibilities:


* Regularly draft pitches, press releases, blog posts and media kit collateral
* Secure consistent and quality media placements through proactive and reactive pitching
* Support planning for social media strategies and influencer campaigns
* Secure and share quality media leads with greater agency
* Develop and maintain strong media relationships with journalists and social media influencers, especially in the travel, food + beverage and luxury lifestyle verticals
* Serve as the primary day-to-day contact for media and clients
* Maintain client relations through meetings, conference calls, events and general contact
* Manage daily administrative activities on accounts including but not limited to media database maintenance and list building, reporting, media monitoring, clip emails, media stay briefs, etc.
* Display clear understanding of client expectations and goals
* Prepare and present meeting agendas, notes and reports
* Assist with developing first drafts of strategic, creative and integrated PR initiatives
* Consume local and national news on a daily basis and stay up to speed on current news and trends, especially with the travel, food + beverage and luxury lifestyle industries
* Assist with organizing and attending media events when needed


Requirements:


* Commuting distance from New York City
* BA or BS in Communications, Public Relations, or related field
* Minimum two-year related experience in travel, food + beverage, hospitality, and/or luxury lifestyle PR preferred
* Possess knowledge working with national travel, food + beverage and lifestyle media
* Proactive, deadline-oriented and highly motivated with strong attention to deail
* Effective organizational and project management skills
* Proven ability to work well under pressure with tight deadlines

* Agency experience is a plus
* Strong verbal and written communication skills
* Proficient in AP style
* Proficiency using Muck Rack, Google Analytics, MS applications, news wire services and server applications such as SharePoint

Quinn is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity and affirmative action employer. We celebrate diversity and do not discriminate based on race, religion, color, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, age, veteran status, disability status, or any other applicable characteristics protected by law.

title: Construction Technician
description:
**CONSTRUCTION TECHNICIAN**


**ABOUT US:**


Blue World Construction has specialized in civil construction projects for over a decade, including work on major remediation sites, commerical and industrial construction projects, and process and mining sites that involve various types of trade work, construction labor, site grading and preparation, expansion of industrial processing plants and pumping systems, and installation of thousands of feet of pipeline associated with various types of utilities. Our offices in Arizona, Texas, and New Jersey rely on our skilled, highly motivated personnel to deliver success on complex and large-scale assignments and have been recognized for the outstanding quality of our work. Once you join the Blue World team, we are committed to showing you respect, helping you grow, and providing you with job security and benefits.


Learn More at: https://bluwrld.com


**JOB DESCRIPTION:**


Blue World Construction is seeking highly motivated, self-starters for the position of Construction Technician. The desired candidate must have previous hands-on construction experience with construction-related field activities such as process piping, working on heavy construction sites, exposed to HDPE butt/electro-fusion welding, above and below ground pipe installation, concrete/form setting, welding of pipe and structural steel and repairs, rigging and fabrication, and working varied shifts in the field under various climates. This is a true 'jack-of'all-trades' position. The ideal candidate must have a good work ethic, a willingness to learn new skills, have a team mentality, and must be safety-oriented in all situations and environments. The candidate will be required to take direction from the project manager(s) and site superintendent, and work independently as well as potentially lead small crews in various tasks. This position requires an ability to perform various types of skilled labor as well.


**QUALIFICATIONS:**


* Construction Experience – minimum 3-5 years preferred in remedial construction, process installation, and site work preferred; 1 year required of piping and construction, specifically irrigation installation


* Driver's License – Required – in good standing


* Reside in central to northern NJ area, but be willing to travel around NJ as needed - per diem and mileage compensation provided when more than 1.5 hrs from Florham Park office. Travel is also required for up to 3 weeks at a time out of state (we go as far west as OR and CA and to the south in TX and FL from time to time).


* Education – high school or equivalent required


* Experience - we need multi-talented individuals that have experience, and are willing to gain additional experience in installing process pipe, HDPE, welding, rigging, equipment operation, installing equipment, carpentry, painting; HDPE fusion beneficial


* The key is understanding our projects require hard working individuals that want to be part of a team, want to grow, can inspire themselves to exceed our expectations every day, and want to grow and develop with our expanding organization in NJ and beyond


**Blue World prides itself on its Drug Free work environment. All employees are subject to an employee drug test, random drug testing, and an employment and annual physical.**


**KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:**


* Performing heavy construction, process construction and environmental remedial construction projects in line with company standards


* Using hand tools and construction equipment safely and efficiently


* Communicating effectively with superiors as well as with construction crew workers


* Taking direction effectively and professionally from Project Managers and Construction Superintendents


* Performing activities outside of typical construction tasks. Experience that is beneficial to have for this position: working with mechanical, pipeline work, electrical, fabrication, masonry, plumbing, and rigging; ability to troubleshoot small engines and equipment, as well as welding preferred.


* Primary role is Field Technician, performing construction-related field activities.


* Requires hands-on work effort in most cases, and ability to adapt to changing conditions quickly and safely; mechanical aptitude and the ability to quickly learn with minimal direction is the key to your ability to move-up in our organization.


* Travel outside NJ will occasionally be required


Minimum education/experience requirements:


* High school diploma at a minimum or equivalent required. Associates degree in science/technology preferred. Certifications for welding and rigging preferred.


**CERTIFICATIONS:**


* OSHA 40-hour HAZWOPER training certification and any current updates are preferred


* Additional certifications such as OSHA 10- or 30-hour Training, Competent Person, MSHA, etc. preferred


**TYPICAL HOURS/SCHEDULE:**


* 7am-4pm


* Monday-Friday


* Overtime is available


PAY: Competitive salary commensurate with experience


**BENEFITS:** waiting period in accordance with the Corporate Employee Handbook; only full-time employees are eligible


* 401(k)


* Dental Insurance


* Health Insurance


* Paid time off


* Vision Insurance


* Vision insurance


**Blue World Construction is committed to our employees' health and safety, and to making sure they are taken care of week in and week out. If you feel like you would make a valuable addition to our team, do not hesitate to apply!**

title: Customer Support Representative
description:
At Togetherhood, we have cultivated a safe and secure community where children can explore diverse interests and discover their passions. We partner with top independent teaching artists and coaches across New York City, New Jersey, and soon, Philadelphia! These passionate educators are dedicated to both their craft and inspiring a love of learning in their students.  

  

Our mission is simple: to infuse every community with high quality enrichment and education.


To help us on this journey, we're seeking a motivated Community Support Representative who will provide top-quality service to our enrichment providers, parents, and schools. To be successful in this role, you should be an excellent communicator capable of earning our customers' trust. Ultimately, you will be at the heart of establishing Togetherhood's reputation for outstanding customer support.


### **Responsibilities**


* Become a subject matter expert on all things Togetherhood, staying informed about our programs and services.
* Deliver an exceptional, personalized service to Togetherhood enrichment providers and parents, ensuring each interaction leaves a lasting positive impression.
* Provide high-quality, timely support to customers via phone, email, text, and chat sessions across multiple platforms.
* Properly categorize all support tickets in the CRM system, maintaining organized and detailed records of each case to completion.
* Be the voice of the customer, advocating for their needs and concerns to improve their overall experience.
* Escalate issues appropriately and drive them to resolution, ensuring that every problem is addressed thoroughly and promptly.


### **Qualifications**


* Minimum 2 years of experience in high-volume customer-facing roles.
* A genuine passion for helping people and fostering positive relationships.
* Outstanding written and verbal communication skills that enable clear and effective interactions with customers both over the phone and email.
* Excellent problem-solver who can navigate complex situations, consider different viewpoints, and find positive solutions, even in challenging conversations.
* Thrive in a dynamic startup environment, demonstrating adaptability and resilience when faced with ambiguity and changes, while maintaining a positive attitude.
* Proficiency in customer relationship management (CRM) tools like HubSpot and project management platforms like Notion.
* The ability to balance empathy with urgency to resolve customer issues efficiently.
* A willingness to tackle and prioritize unexpected needs head-on, with a commitment to see tasks through to completion.
* The ability to stay calm and focused under pressure.
* Background in education or childhood development is a plus! bringing additional insights and empathy to interactions with our community.
* You are motivated by our mission.
* Note: This is NOT a remote position. We have a beautiful office in Bryant Park, and at this stage in our company it is very important to collaborate and work together in person. Please do not apply if you are looking for remote work.

title: Construction Superintendent
description:
**CONSTRUCTION SUPERINTENDENT**


**ABOUT US:**


Blue World Construction has specialized in civil construction projects for over a decade, including work on major remediation sites,mining and industrial process plants, and small to large industrial projects that involve site grading and preparation, expansion of industrial processing plants and pumping systems, and installation of thousands of feet of pipeline associated with various types of utilities. Our offices in Arizona, Texas, and New Jersey rely on our skilled, highly motivated personnel to deliver success on complex and large-scale assignments and have been recognized for the outstanding quality of our work. Once you join the Blue World team, we are committed to showing you respect, helping you grow, and providing you with job security and benefits.


*Learn More at:* https://bluwrld.com


**JOB DESCRIPTION:**


**This is not your typical superintendent job**—Blue World is looking for a **Construction Superintendent** with a **diverse construction background** who not only can follow and implement a project schedule and run a crew, but who is also ready to **take part in hands-on** work, including operating machinery and being competent with site layout, carpentry, and welding. We are looking for someone who not only has the experience to handle these tasks, but more importantly who has the **desire to teach and instruct others** to do the same so that he or she is free to run the job, rather than always completing the hands-on tasks themselves.


**This job does not involve sitting in a trailer all day**: while Blue World has a multi-talented crew that works on diverse types of projects in and around New Jersey, we need your help not only to be a part of our skilled team, but also to **run our jobs smoothly and efficiently**. This includes scheduling and directing the crew each morning, filling out necessary paperwork, and finishing the day up making sure the job is organized, the crew informed, and communicating with the client to ensure their utmost satisfaction. At the same time, our jobs allow you to take an **active role in site construction** at times during the day, such as operating machinery or getting involved with your hands. Most importantly, the best candidates will demonstrate an **excellent work ethic**, a **willingness to learn** new skills, a **team mentality**, and must be **safety-oriented** in all situations and environments. In turn, there are many opportunities for growth, promotion, and compensation.


This position, more than most, requires a **self-motivated**, hard-working individual that leads and **manages by example**, is excellent with **troubleshooting**, and can manage staff and work with clients in a quiet and professional manner.


**QUALIFICATIONS:**


* Construction Experience—10-20 years diverse construction experience; experience in water/wastewater, heavy site and civil construction, pipeline installation, operating heavy equipment, welding, and masonry are necessary for this “jack-of-all-trades" position
* Driver's License—Required and in good standing
* Education—high school or equivalent required; training & certifications HDPE pipe fusion, equipment operation, welding and/or rigging preferred

**Blue World prides itself on its Drug Free work environment. All employees are subject to an employee drug test, random drug testing, and an employment and annual physical.**


**KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:**


* Creating, implementing, and monitoring site logistics while site is in operation
* Be present on-site daily while site is active
* Communicate with Project Managers and clients effectively and professionally
* Review construction drawings and specifications and have strong understanding of project goals and direction; ensure work is being done to accomplish these goals in the timeliest manner
* Have strong knowledge and understanding of project safety and construction guidelines; ensure these guidelines are always followed to the utmost degree by construction crew
* Schedule and plan project tasks and phases, coordinating effectively with Project Manager and site crew to ensure job stays on-time
* Submitting daily and weekly paperwork, such as daily logs
* Maintain accurate records of site activity and performance
* Ensure site materials and equipment remain organized and site looks neat and professional
* Understand his/her role within a team setting—as well as the strengths and weaknesses of the entire team—to effectively allocate resources and seek out the best help to maximize success
* Raise concerns, when applicable, regarding compliance with safety or construction guidelines
* Operate heavy machinery, such as dozers and excavators
* Get involved in site activities, such as the installation of pipe above and below ground, carpentry, and welding
* Allocate his/her own time effectively

**TYPICAL HOURS/SCHEDULE:**


* 7am-4pm
* Monday-Friday
* Overtime is available

**PAY:** *Competitive salary commensurate with experience*


**BENEFITS:** *waiting period in accordance with the Corporate Employee Handbook; only full-time employees are eligible*


* 401(k)
* Dental Insurance
* Health Insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision Insurance

**Blue World Construction is committed to our employees' health and safety, and to making sure they are taken care of week in and week out. If you feel like you would make a valuable addition to our team, don't hesitate to apply!**

title: Social Worker Supervisor
description:
We are partnering with York Street Project (a ministry of Sisters of St. Joseph of Peace) to hire a **Social Worker Supervisor** with a background in psychosocial/clinical responsibilities for the organization's housing program. The ideal candidate should be knowledgeable and skilled in working with vulnerable and at-risk populations, helping them stabilize their families and grow toward self-sufficiency and independence. This position requires a valid and current LMSW license. This is a full-time, onsite position located in Jersey City, NJ. The salary range is from $67,000 up to $75,000 per year.


**Overview:**


* Supervisory responsibilities include assigning, scheduling, monitoring, and controlling work for staff and social work interns; evaluating and managing performance; interviewing, hiring, and orienting new employees; training employees when necessary; making salary recommendations; and recommending coaching, discipline, or termination when necessary.
* Assessing the psycho-social status and needs of housing unstable families and their children
* Recruiting new families for housing programs and Participating in the interview and intake process
* Assisting in the development of individual service plans
* Carrying out social evaluations through individual therapy sessions and planning interventions based on the findings
* Maintaining clinical records on all participants
* Utilizing the internal database (Apricot) to maintain client documents
* Utilizing the national homeless database Homeless Management Information System (HMIS) to manage intakes and discharges
* Developing and maintaining collaborative relationships with community agencies/partners that can supplement services to participants.
	+ Serves as liaison between participant and community agencies/partners
	+ Acts as support service team's point of contact for all specialty programming and services (i.e. mental health, behavioral health, substance use, domestic violence, child welfare, etc.)
* Provides information and referral services for community resources to participants
* Attending interdisciplinary group meetings; and attending and participating in community meetings.
* Actively participating in the planning and execution of activities and events that improve the quality of life and stabilization of families.
* Researching and keeping current with evidence-based therapeutic services, tools, and clinical models
* Supervising MSW interns (supervision, instruction, and assessment):
	+ Acts as point of contact with the School of Social Work department
	+ Possesses or willing to complete Seminar in Field Instruction (SIFI)

**Education:**


* Master's Degree in Social Work
* Valid and current LMSW license
* Seminar in Field Instruction (SIFI) certified or willingness to complete
* Prior work with poor/minority groups, especially young women and children.
* Ability to practice on individual, family and group level.
* Able to analyze, assess and intervene on systemic level.
* Possess diagnostic and treatment skills.
* Theoretical appreciation and practice in family system model, Comprehensive Youth Centered Service Model, Trauma Informed Care, Critical Time Intervention, Motivational Interviewing, and Strengths Based therapeutic models.
* Knowledgeable of Homeless Management Information System (HMIS)


**Qualifications and Skills:**


* Experience in supervising and managing staff.
* Able to analyze, assess and intervene on systemic level.
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills
* Proficiency with Microsoft Office Suite and experience with case management or related software and databases is a plus!
* Ability to work with ethnic and racial minority groups, especially women and children.
* Commitment to establish a model of personal and institutional development that flows from values of inclusiveness and cooperation.
* Commitment to values of mutuality and collaboration.
* Valid driver's license preferred.
* Bilingual/Spanish preferred.


**Benefits for Full-time Employees:**


* Excellent health insurance, dental insurance, and vision insurance
* Generous paid time off
* Life Insurance

title: Social Media Intern
description:

The Social Media Intern will work with the Panasonic Marketing and Communications Social Media Team to create, curate and promote engaging conversations across Panasonic North America social media channels to drive awareness of Panasonic brand and technology solutions.

title: Strategic Account Manager- Federal Integrators
description:
Overview: Currently, PCONA has an immediate opening available for a Strategic Account Manager Integrators, located in the US, near a major airport for nationwide travel. Responsibilities:

The Strategic Account Manager is responsible for developing and executing a strategy to develop and close strategic business opportunities and position Panasonic Connect for the sale of Toughbook Mobile computers and associated services through Federal Integrators across the United States and worldwide. The position with require 50 to 75 percent travel, primarily CONUS.

**Education and Experience**

* Bachelors Degree in Business and or Marketing or equivalent
* 8 plus Years proven track record in direct end user technology sales
* Previous experience selling to the Dept of Defense
* Previous experience in strategic program capture a plus
* Proficient user of Microsoft Office including Excel, Word and PowerPoint

**Communication Skills**

* Must have excellent interpersonal, communication, and customer service skills
* Must be able to clearly communicate with customers:
	+ Convey TOUGHBOOK and Panasonic Connect value proposition and ability to execute
	+ Position TOUGHBOOK and Panasonic Connect to set requirements
* Ability to communicate and collaborate with coworkers (ie engineering, product management, capture, etc) and partners to gain support and ensure requirements are met.

**Responsibilities**

* Understand the target markets, including industry, company, projects, contacts and which market strategies can be used to pursue strategic Federal Business
* Maintain a strong understanding of Toughbook products and services, our competition in the industry, and positioning.
* Expectation is that the candidate will bring long term opportunities to closure, resulting in the profitable sale of Panasonic Connect products and services.

title: Sales Enablement Manager
description:
Overview:

Sales Enablement Manager will be tasked with creating training programs, developing content, coordinating certifications, tracking completion, collaborating with cross functional BUs and expanding solution enablement as the Toughbook business continues to diversify.


Responsibilities:
**Accountability**

 **Item 1 Sales Training and Development**

* Develop and implement comprehensive sales training programs utilizing Korn Ferry Strategic Selling with Perspective and continuously upskill existing sales team members
* Create sales training materials, including presentations, playbooks, and online modules, tailored to different stages of the sales cycle and various customer segments
* Conduct training sessions, workshops, and coaching sessions to enhance sales team effectiveness and performance.

 **Item 2 Content Development and Management**

* Collaborate with Marketing and Product teams to create compelling sales collateral, including presentations, case studies, product guides, and sales scripts.
* Ensure sales content is current, relevant, and aligned with the companys messaging and positioning.
* Establish a centralized repository for sales content and provide sales representatives with easy access to relevant resources.

 **Item 3 Sales Process Optimization**

* Analyze sales processes and identify opportunities for improvement and efficiency gains.
* Work closely with Sales Operations to implement best practices, streamline workflows, and optimize sales technologies.
* Develop and maintain sales playbooks outlining standardized processes and tactics for various scenarios.
* Evaluate, implement, and manage sales enablement tools and technologies to support the sales teams productivity and effectiveness.
* Provide training and support to sales representatives on the use of sales enablement software and other relevant tools.
* Integrate 3rd party solution partner expansion through the Xcelerate program and future Marketplace expansion efforts.

 **Item 4 Performance Measurement and Analytics**

* Define key performance metrics for sales enablement initiatives and track their impact on sales productivity and revenue generation.
* Generate reports and dashboards to measure the effectiveness of sales training programs, content utilization, and sales process improvements.
* Use data driven insights to continuously refine and optimize sales enablement strategies and tactics.

 **Item 5 Cross-Functional Collaboration**

* Foster strong relationships with Sales, Marketing, Product Management, HQ Operations, and other relevant departments to ensure alignment and collaboration on sales enablement initiatives.
* Act as a liaison between different teams to gather feedback, identify challenges, and implement solutions that support the overall sales strategy.

 **Basic Qualifications**

  

Scope

* Sales Enablement Manager will be tasked with creating training programs, developing content, coordinating certifications, tracking completion, collaborating with cross functional BUs and expanding solution enablement as the Toughbook business continues to diversify.

  

Education and Experience

  

* 5 to 10 years of Marketing, Sales Enablement, Sales Training and or Program Management Experience
* Bachelors Degree preferred Marketing and or Communications and or Graphic Design

  

Key Competencies

* Program and or Project Management
* Graphic Design and or Content Creation
* Salesforce experience preferred
* Experience with KFSell Miller Heiman preferred
* Mastery of Microsoft tools PPT, Excel, Power BI, etc.
* Strong Presentation and Interpersonal skills

  

Other Requirements

* Travel is required 25 percent

 **What We Offer:****The salary range of 119,000 –$165,000 is just one component of Panasonic’s total package. Actual compensation varies depending on the individual’s knowledge, skills, and experience. This role may be eligible for discretionary bonuses and incentives.*** High Performance Culture

title: Territory Account Manager – Air Force
description:
Overview:  

The Territory Account Manager is responsible for identifying, developing and closing sales of Panasonic **Rugged Laptops, Tablets, Handhelds, Mobility Products and Services to the United States Air Force and other Non Uniformed agencies of the Department of Defense**agencies in an assigned territory including **Air Force****.**


Responsibilities:
**Job Summary and or Basic Function**

  



The Territory Account Manager is responsible for identifying, developing and closing sales of Panasonic **Rugged Laptops, Tablets, Handhelds, Mobility Products and Services to the United States Air Force and other Non Uniformed agencies of the Department of Defense** agencies in an assigned territory including **Air Force.** This hard charging, proactive and independent sales professional will use their 5 to 10 years of direct sales experience in the technology industry to drive incremental business of Panasonic Solutions including hardware, software and services. The TAM will develop, implement and manage a strategic business and sales plan for their given region. We are looking for previous Air Force experience and the candidate must possess direct knowledge of Air Force Command Structure, Programs related to Rugged and Semi Rugged Mobility, and other Air Force acquisition methodologies.

**Major Responsibilities**

 **1. Selling and or Account Management and or Customer Service**

* Attain minimum of 100 percent of assigned sales quota
* Develop business and relationships with Assigned End Users and VA's through close communications and personal visits.
* Promote new and key products to this customer base through demonstrations and presentations.
* Develop and manage sales and marketing programs to develop increased awareness and demand for our products.
* Maintain records of customer information and performance. Establish goals and track performance to objectives
* Manage customer service issues to ensure the highest level of customer satisfaction and retention

 **2. Prospect Development**

* Develop and identify new end user opportunities through prospecting and key end user calls and demos to meet the company objectives of pipeline development.
* Work with VARs as much as possible to help develop this new business through the dealer channel
* Maintain data base of calls to prospects for future use and communications
* Attend trade shows and events to identify new prospects
* Establish relationships with PCSC Synergy Partners to expand sales reach and prospect base

 **3. Planning Administration**

* Provide timely, accurate and complete sales reports and forecasts. Attend required sales conference calls
* Give thorough market feedback to management
* Give a high degree of attention to individual ASR performance against the assigned business plan
* Plan activities, agendas, programs with achieving business budget always in mind
* Give high attention to the plan numbers, current and projected performance to that plan

 **4. Product Knowledge**

* Maintain a high level of product technical knowledge
* Maintain a high level of competitive product awareness
* Develop and maintain a high level of knowledge in the specific needs of the company focused vertical market sectors
* Maintain awareness of changes in technologies and communicate this knowledge on to your dealers and or customers

 **Basic Qualifications**

 **Scope**

* 8 million dollar revenue expectation for full Fiscal Year. Air Force Team is on team quota and position will be paid on that revenue and quota.

 **Education and Experience**

* Bachelors Degree in Business and or Marketing or equivalent
* 3 plus Years direct end user technology sales to the Air Force or other DoD agencies

 **Problem Solving**

* Work with established team to handle complex sales to the United States Air Force and Non Uniformed DoD accounts.

  

**Communications**

* Must have strong communications skills to include presentation experience to groups of 20 plus people

  

**Other Requirements**

* 50 to 75 percent travel required

 **What We Offer:**  

**The salary range of $65,000 –$95,000 is just one component of Panasonic’s total package. Actual compensation varies depending on the individual’s knowledge, skills, and experience. This role may be eligible for discretionary bonuses and incentives.**

title: Scarsdale Farmers Market Manager
description:
APPLY NOW  

Posted 7/29/24  




Part-time, $20/hour position available at our brand new farmers market in Scarsdale. Work hours are weekly on Sundays from 7am-3pm at the market, located at the intersection of Spencer Road and Chase Place, and a few additional hours at home to file reports and occasionally in the field to help with promotion (generally a total of 8-10 hours weekly).


This is an ideal position for someone with retail, management, customer service, teaching, or other leadership experience, who is interested in learning about and contributing to the local food system. You should be friendly and happy to talk to all kinds of people, willing to do some physical work, able to communicate clearly and with confidence to both your Down to Earth colleagues and the vendors and customers in the market, organized and aware of the importance of good record keeping and reporting.


The Farmers Market Manager oversees day-of-market operations as Down to Earth Markets' on-site representative, working closely with the company's office team to help ensure the market's success and spearhead interactions with market vendors, shoppers and the community:


* Supervising and managing daily operations to assure a smooth- and safe-running market
* Enforcing market rules and regulations
* Proactively and consistently communicating with the office team
* Collaborating closely with the market's co-manager
* Collecting and reporting market data and success metrics
* Setting up and breaking down the market manager tent and display, market signage, and any other Down to Earth equipment as needed
* Posting to Facebook/Instagram on behalf of the market on market days and work with the Digital Marketing Manager to provide information and images from the market for marketing purposes
* Selling farmers market branded items
* Taking initiative in providing customer service; serving as a market host to welcome and engage shoppers, promoting good relations between vendors, our company, and the shoppers
* Assisting shoppers and vendors with use of food access and nutrition programs (SNAP, FMNP)
* Reporting successes, concerns and opportunities to Down to Earth Markets; sharing feedback and ideas
* Occasionally representing the farmers market at community events and through flyer distributions
* Attending weekly conference calls with fellow managers and the Operations Manager

Occasionally filling in for fellow site managers at other market locations  
* 

Physical / schedule requirements:


* Commit to consistently working 8-10 hours a week
* Able to lift and carry up to 50 pounds
* Able to walk and stand for several hours at a time
* Able to work in all weather conditions, e.g. heat, cold, rain, sun, wind, snow
* Lead market set up and breakdown, including directing people and vehicles, moving equipment, and cleaning up the market site as needed
* Complete two days of shadowing alongside another site manager at another farmers market as part of training
* Complete remote training, using a computer or smartphone, outside of market hours
* Complete the required flyer distribution blitz outside of market hours
* Communicate regularly, effectively, and in detail, including filing timely reports, to ensure a steady flow of information between the market and the office
* Monitor and reply to messages from the office, especially around end-of market reporting and pre-market prep
* Have use of a smartphone to use Microsoft Teams, our reporting web app, and Facebook/Instagram/Meta Business Suite during the market day

We are seeking candidates who are available to start immediately. Training will be provided.  

APPLY NOW


-


Down to Earth Markets is a mission-driven Benefit Corporation and Certified B Corporation using business as a power for positive change in the world.


All employment decisions that Down to Earth makes are based on organizational needs, job requirements and the employee's or applicant's qualifications. We are an equal opportunity employer. All job applicants are welcome regardless of race, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran or disability status.

title: Morningside Park Farmers Market Manager
description:
APPLY NOW  

Posted 7/29/24  




Part-time, $19/hour position available at our year-round Morningside Park Farmers Market in Manhattan. Work hours are weekly on Saturdays from 7am-3pm at the market, located near the corner of West 110th Street and Manhattan Avenue, and a few additional hours at home to file reports and occasionally in the field to help with promotion (generally a total of 8-10 hours weekly).


This is an ideal position for someone with retail, management, customer service, teaching, or other leadership experience, who is interested in learning about and contributing to the local food system. You should be friendly and happy to talk to all kinds of people, willing to do some physical work, able to communicate clearly and with confidence to both your Down to Earth colleagues and the vendors and customers in the market, organized and aware of the importance of good record keeping and reporting.


The Farmers Market Manager oversees day-of-market operations as Down to Earth Markets' on-site representative, working closely with the company's office team to help ensure the market's success and spearhead interactions with market vendors, shoppers and the community:


* Supervising and managing daily operations to assure a smooth- and safe-running market
* Enforcing market rules and regulations
* Proactively and consistently communicating with the office team
* Collaborating closely with the market's co-manager
* Collecting and reporting market data and success metrics
* Setting up and breaking down the market manager tent and display, market signage, and any other Down to Earth equipment as needed
* Posting to Facebook/Instagram on behalf of the market on market days and work with the Digital Marketing Manager to provide information and images from the market for marketing purposes
* Selling farmers market branded items
* Taking initiative in providing customer service; serving as a market host to welcome and engage shoppers, promoting good relations between vendors, our company, and the shoppers
* Assisting shoppers and vendors with use of food access and nutrition programs (SNAP, FMNP)
* Reporting successes, concerns and opportunities to Down to Earth Markets; sharing feedback and ideas
* Occasionally representing the farmers market at community events and through flyer distributions
* Attending weekly conference calls with fellow managers and the Operations Manager

Occasionally filling in for fellow site managers at other market locations  
* 

Physical / schedule requirements:


* Commit to consistently working 8-10 hours a week
* Able to lift and carry up to 50 pounds
* Able to walk and stand for several hours at a time
* Able to work in all weather conditions, e.g. heat, cold, rain, sun, wind, snow
* Lead market set up and breakdown, including directing people and vehicles, moving equipment, and cleaning up the market site as needed
* Complete two days of shadowing alongside another site manager at another farmers market as part of training
* Complete remote training, using a computer or smartphone, outside of market hours
* Complete the required flyer distribution blitz outside of market hours
* Communicate regularly, effectively, and in detail, including filing timely reports, to ensure a steady flow of information between the market and the office
* Monitor and reply to messages from the office, especially around end-of market reporting and pre-market prep
* Have use of a smartphone to use Microsoft Teams, our reporting web app, and Facebook/Instagram/Meta Business Suite during the market day

We are seeking candidates who are available to start immediately. Training will be provided.

title: Sales Coordinator - C
description:
Overview:

The PIDSA Sales Coordinator C position serves as the first point of contact relative to customer service requirements. Collaborates internally with Sales, Product Engineering, Finance, Credit, factories and warehouses to communicate customer requirements


Responsibilities:

Panasonic Sales Coordinator - C

  

Every moment of every day, people all over the world turn to Panasonic to make their lives simpler, more enjoyable, more productive and more secure. Since our founding almost a century ago, we’ve been committed to improving peoples’ lives and making the world a better place–one customer, one business, one innovative leap at a time. Come join our journey.  

  

Click here to learn more about how Panasonic is creating a better life, a better world.  

  

Watch this video to see how our employees are shaping the technologies that move us

 **What You'll Get To Do:**

  

The PIDSA Sales Coordinator C position serves as the first point of contact relative to customer service requirements. Collaborates internally with Sales, Product Engineering, Finance, Credit, factories and warehouses to communicate customer requirements. Communicates with external partners in the supply chain to ensure on time delivery and maintain a high level of customer satisfaction. Determines best method to achieve customer satisfaction while adhering to company policies. Maintains knowledge of products, services, policies and procedures. Recommends and implements ideas for improvement to achieve higher work efficiencies. **Please note this is a Union position.**

 **Customer Service Support**

* Serves as the first line of contact with the customer relative to order status.
* Proactively communicates status of orders throughout the supply chain and resolves issues that may prevent on time delivery.
* Provides sales administration support to Sales team.
* Interfaces with factories to resolve order and production issues.
* Champions customers requirements through communication and collaboration with internal departments including Sales, Credit, Product Management and Engineering, IT support team, Logistics, Finance and Accounting.
* Educates customers on the Panasonic processes and lead times.
* Maintains general product knowledge to support customer inquiries.
* Resolves chargebacks related to price, quantity and contractual requirements.
* Creates and maintains customer profiles
* Identifies and raises up ideas for system and process improvements.
* Proactively identifies root cause of errors to prevent reoccurrence.
* Shares knowledge with new employees and participates in training efforts
* May provide documentation to support SOX audits.
* May process Quotations as needed.

**Order Management and Logistics**

* Process Drop, Stock and Consignment sales orders received via EDI, email, or web portal. Resolve order discrepancies and exceptions timely, within policy.
* Manage all administrative aspects of Consignment and Stocking programs.
* Create sales orders, delivery notes, and post goods issue in SAP.
* Review invoice documents. Post documents to customer portal and create ASNs as needed.
* Ensure transactions are closed within policy.
* Collaborate with third party warehouse to prevent shipping delays and reconcile inventory as needed.
* Review Order Confirmations from factories to ensure correctness.
* Review factory shipping schedules for drop orders as needed.
* May process sample orders as needed.
* Manage order changes, cancellations, and expedites in accordance with policy
* Initiate and process requests for CM, DM, RMA
* May process export and inventory transfer requests
* Proactively analyze Open Order reports to identify and resolve issues that may prevent on time delivery.
* Provide reports to external and internal customers as needed.
* Collaborates with supply chain partners to solve discrepancies, track shipments, manage exceptions and achieve on time delivery.
* Routinely executes all reports identified on the SOX Log to identify exceptions and resolve potential problems in the supply chain.

**Reporting**

* May be responsible for research and providing data for the PSI report and Sales Flash
* Supports sales requests for reports as needed

**Internal Controls**

* Follow proper internal controls as established by the company
* Ensure compliance with SOX and other departmental policy is followed.

**What You'll Bring:**

**Education & Experience**

* College degree (AA) preferred or equivalent work experience in customer service and sales support.
* 3+ years customer service experience in a manufacturing and distribution environment is mandatory
* Preferred experience working within a Global Company.
* Functional ability to operate PC and appropriate software including MS Office Suite, Outlook, Teams, SharePoint, Excel.
* Preferred Functional knowledge and ability of SAP and EDI
* Competencies
* Highly Organized people person able to prioritize issues and act with a sense of urgency
* Ability to learn new IT based efficiency tools and apply to day to day assignments
* Ability to work in a fast paced, time sensitive environment, adapting new priorities throughout the day.
* Ability to take initiative to identify and implement new processes and procedures to achieve higher levels of efficiencies.
* Professional written and verbal communication. Tactful and diplomatic.
* Ability to articulate problems and solutions in a concise, simple to understand language.

**Communications**

* Internal Daily communication in the Order to Cash cycle including IT Support, Sales, Product Engineers, Finance, Accounting, Overseas factories, Distribution Centers, Import and Export, Accounts Receivable  

External Customers, Buyers, Manufacturers Sales Representatives, Logistics
* Ability to respond rapidly to a large volume of written requests.

**Other Requirements**

* Up to 5% travel may be required.


Qualifications:
**What We Offer:**

  

Competitive compensation package  

Comprehensive benefits  

Pet Insurance  

Paid Parental Care Leave  

Employee Referral Program  

Educational Assistance  

Flexible Work Program  

Volunteer time Off  

Casual Dress Code  

Total Well Being Program

  

Panasonic is proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender identity, sex, sexual orientation, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, and any other characteristic protected by law or company policy. All qualified individuals are required to perform the essential functions of the job with or without reasonable accommodation. Pre-employment drug testing is required for safety sensitive positions or as may otherwise be required by contract or law. Due to the high volume of responses, we will only be able to respond to candidates of interest. All candidates must have valid authorization to work in the U.S. Thank you for your interest in Panasonic Corporation of North America.  

  

**WE TAKE OPPORTUNITY SERIOUSLY:**  

Panasonic prioritizes total wellbeing. We offer a wide variety of benefits and programs to support your physical, emotional, financial, social and environmental health.


The salary of $35.02/hrly is just one component of Panasonic’s total package. Actual compensation varies depending on the individual’s knowledge, skills, experience, and location. This role may be eligible for discretionary bonuses and incentives.


We understand that your career search may look different than others and embrace the professional, personal, educational, and volunteer opportunities through which people gain experience. If you are actively looking or starting to explore new opportunities, send us your application!

title: Team Lead Digitial and Creative Marketing
description:
Overview:

Reporting to the Head of Marketing, the team lead of the Center of Excellence encompassing digital and creative teams will be responsible for leading the digital marketing efforts and creative excellence across 3 business divisions.


Responsibilities:
**Panasonic Team Lead, Digital and Creative Marketing**

  

Every moment of every day, people all over the world turn to Panasonic to make their lives simpler, more enjoyable, more productive and more secure. Since our founding almost a century ago, we’ve been committed to improving peoples’ lives and making the world a better place–one customer, one business, one innovative leap at a time. Come join our journey.

  

Click here to learn more about how Panasonic is creating a better life, a better world.  

  

Watch this video to see how our employees are shaping the technologies that move us

 **What You'll Get To Do:**

  

Reporting to the Head of Marketing, the team lead of the Center of Excellence (encompassing digital and creative teams) will be responsible for leading the digital marketing efforts and creative excellence across 3 business divisions. This includes developing strategic digital marketing plans, managing, and optimizing campaigns across various digital platforms, analyzing data to inform decisions, and ensuring content and creative are engaging, best in class and SEO-friendly. This role will lead a multidisciplinary team and leads and drives the results of the team by directing the strategy, development, execution, and maintenance of all B2B and B2C digital and social marketing activities across Panasonic Eco Systems North America (PESNA). This leader will play a pivotal role as a strategic change agent to elevate the digital marketing capability and creative excellence with exceptional communication and collaboration skills to align with other stakeholders on priorities for achieving business goals.

 **Digital Marketing Strategy and Implementation:**

* Defines, develops, communicates, leads and executes comprehensive B2B and B2C digital marketing strategies and tactics, including but not limited to SEO, SEM, website, online advertising, email marketing (DM, newsletters), and social media (organic, paid) to support PESNA’s business objectives.
* Builds and manages project plans for digital marketing activities, including objectives, goals, strategies, tactics, KPIs and effectiveness measurements.  

Define and monitor key performance indicators to measure the success and impact of marketing initiatives and enablement.
* Continuously track, measure and analyze digital marketing capability performance, leveraging industry trends, best practices and insights as a key input to both continuous improvement and the future strategy and roadmap.

**Team Management and Education and Capability Growth:**

  

* Leads multidisciplinary team members representing a broad set of marketing skills including digital marketing (SEO, SEM, website, online advertisement, email marketing and social media), demand generation, lead generation and process management, CRM, Analytics, content strategy and production and design.
* Identifies, designs and implements scalable processes and systems to optimize marketing efficiency and effectiveness.  

Sets strategic direction for and leads, manages, educates, coaches and mentors a cohesive, collaborative, high performing team of marketing professionals.
* Develops the team’s capability based on the latest trends and best practices across key platforms such as Meta (Facebook, Instagram), Google (Search, Display, YouTube), and other relevant digital channels.
* Develops and implements training programs to enhance the team's skills and capabilities in digital marketing and creative best practices, ensuring proficiency in platform specific tools and techniques.
* Leadership and Collaboration
* Works closely with leadership to define and develop digital marketing solutions, understanding PESNA’s business and competitive market landscape and providing guidance and influence to various business units to ensure overall digital marketing effectiveness.
* Collaborates with business and marketing leaders to ensure digital and social marketing activities meet business requirements and needs.

**Performance Monitoring and Improvement**

* Develops and implements testing strategies to improve KPIs including creative/copy testing, audience segmentation, ad placements, and retargeting strategies to maximize performance.
* Evaluates digital marketing analytics and reporting to identify effectiveness and gaps in initiatives.
* Develops KPIs, monitors performance, and adjusts strategies and tactics to ensure goals are met.
* Makes actionable recommendations for improving performance and meeting PESNA marketing strategic goals.
* Maintains an up to date understanding of marketing trends and new digital capability launches, competitor activities, and social engagement to continually improve the competitive digital position and identify new digital opportunities.

 **Website and Content Management**

* Leads the design, development, execution, tracking and maintenance of all business units’ websites, including frontend and backend website management; redefines, redesigns, launches, and ensuring that content and features meet functional and emotional needs for category leadership.
* Creative and Content Management
* Manages the creation and execution of content and creative, ensuring it aligns with marketing strategies and resonates with target audiences.
* Oversees the development and management of creative and content for all marketing deliverables, ensuring high quality, engaging materials that effectively communicate the PESNA’s brand and message with humancentric views.
* Leads producing compelling creative assets, including graphics, videos, and copy for marketing materials, including but not limited to digital and social media campaigns, offline events e.g. tradeshows, kickoffs, sales enablement materials, marketing collaterals, POPs and product package.

**Vendor Management**

* Oversees relationships with vendors, including but not limited to inhouse agencies, digital agencies, media planning agencies, creative agency, photo/video production companies and social media management, ensuring deliverables from the vendors meet with the expectation and align with PESNA's marketing strategies.
* Collaborates with other Panasonic marketing, IT, legal teams to make sure all the marketing activations are aligned with business requirements and compatible with existing infrastructure and data security requirements.
* **Education:**  

Bachelor's Degree: Preferably in Communication, Marketing, or Business required
* MBA in Marketing: Preferred.
* Growth Mindset: Demonstrates a strong growth mindset with a drive to obtain new skills and knowledge, especially when encountering new learning opportunities.

**Other:**

* Participates in special projects and performs other duties as assigned.

  


Qualifications:
**What We Offer:**

  

Competitive compensation package  

Comprehensive benefits  

Pet Insurance  

Paid Parental Care Leave  

Employee Referral Program  

Educational Assistance  

Flexible Work Program  

Volunteer time Off  

Casual Dress Code  

Total Well Being Program

  

Panasonic is proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender identity, sex, sexual orientation, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, and any other characteristic protected by law or company policy. All qualified individuals are required to perform the essential functions of the job with or without reasonable accommodation. Pre-employment drug testing is required for safety sensitive positions or as may otherwise be required by contract or law. Due to the high volume of responses, we will only be able to respond to candidates of interest. All candidates must have valid authorization to work in the U.S. Thank you for your interest in Panasonic Corporation of North America.  

  

**WE TAKE OPPORTUNITY SERIOUSLY:**  

  

Panasonic prioritizes total wellbeing. We offer a wide variety of benefits and programs to support your physical, emotional, financial, social and environmental health.  

  

The salary range of $140k - $165k is just one component of Panasonic’s total package. Actual compensation varies depending on the individual’s knowledge, skills, experience, and location. This role may be eligible for discretionary bonuses and incentives.

title: Payroll Manager
description:
Overview:
Every moment of every day, people all over the world turn to Panasonic to make their lives simpler, more enjoyable, more productive, and more secure. Since our founding almost a century ago, we’ve been committed to improving peoples’ lives and making the world a better place–one customer, one business, one innovative leap at a time. Come join our journey.
Responsibilities:
**Click here to learn more** about how Panasonic is creating a better life, a better world.  

  

**Watch this video** to see how our employees are shaping the technologies that move us.  

This role is responsible for directing the day to day payroll functions while ensuring a high level of customer service and satisfaction. Partners with and supports internal users and management in issue resolution and the development of new processes. Responsible for ensuring all statutory and collective bargaining agreement compliance in electronic timekeeping and payroll programs. Oversees liens, garnishments, 401k and other deductions. The successful candidate will have a strong track record of working in a highly collaborative environment with the ability to coach staff, deliver industry best practices, high quality standard operating procedures and monitoring controls.

**What You’ll Get to Do:**
1. Management and Shared Service Operations

* Responsible for managing the Americas, US, shared service payroll operations.
* Manage, develop, coach, and support 7 direct reports located in 3 regions within the U.S., East Coast, West Coast, and Midwest.
* Establish a high performing team and lead a culture of accountability in order to provide quality service to HR Shared Service customers.
* Develop payroll strategy and partner with Human Resources, Legal, Finance, and Tax Departments in automation, compliance and customer centric initiatives.
* Direct team on M and A activity and payroll related projects.
* Create and maintain strong working relationships with third party vendors pertaining to unemployment claims management, garnishments, commuter benefits, and health and welfare.
* Ensure Service Level Agreements are adhered to, addressing trends to eliminate manual labor and create plans for system configurations.
* Contributes to the design and implementation of company policies and procedures.


2. Payroll Processing and Compliance

* Partner with Payroll Accounting Department guaranteeing payments and deductions are calculated and disbursed timely.
* Remain up to date and provide direction on changing U.S. employment tax legislations, FLSA and state wage law, and garnishment administration.
* Sign off on payroll staff processing and auditing of weekly, bi weekly, semi monthly, and monthly pay cycles for approximately 14,000 U.S. domestic employees.
* Ensures compilation and preparation of payroll data for various reporting functions such as 401K, health insurance, etc.
* Responsible for timely and favorable audit findings related to SOX, internal audits, external audits, and local union reviews.
* Remains current on new legislation and regulatory rulings impacting payroll Enforces adherence to requirements and advises management on necessary action plans when warranted.
* Monitors and ensures updated statutory regulations and compliance in Workday timekeeping module.
* Oversee garnishments, 401k, and all other employee and employer payroll deductions.


Scope* This position has seven direct reports
**What You’ll Bring:**
Education and Experience

* Degree in Business Administration, Accounting, HR Management or equivalent work experience.
* 5 to 7 years’ experience managing a multi state payroll function
* Experience with Workday HCM, Payroll, Time Tracking required as well as ADP WorkforceNow.
* American Payroll Association and, or SHRM member.


Competencies

* Ability to manage and coach team with strong leadership capabilities.
* Demonstrate strong ability to influence key stake holders.
* Ability to analyze complex payroll situations and direct staff accordingly.
* Excellent problem solving skills.
* Proficiency with MS Office applications, payroll software, and report writing.
* Self starter with the ability to work with minimal supervision in a team environment.
* Good time management skills in order to meet continuous critical deadlines.
* Detail oriented, high level of accuracy and completeness of work, able to detect inconsistencies in data, able to prepare and process payroll documentation accurately and in a timely manner.
* Experience complying with audit procedures, tax and accounting practices, company policies and procedures.
* Strong analytical and problem solving skills required.
* Strong interpersonal and customer service skills. Able to establish and maintain cooperative working relationships, and to deal tactfully and courteously with team members and other staff when explaining the functions and policies in the Payroll Department.
* Maintain confidential information when required by legal or ethical standards and professionalism to ensure privacy of employee records.


Communications

* Excellent oral and written communication skills required

**What We Offer:**  

* Competitive compensation package
* Comprehensive benefits
* Pet Insurance
* Paid Parental Care Leave
* Employee Referral Program
* Educational Assistance
* Flexible Work Program
* Volunteer time Off
* Casual Dress Code
* Total Well Being Program



Panasonic is proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender identity, sex, sexual orientation, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, and any other characteristic protected by law or company policy. All qualified individuals are required to perform the essential functions of the job with or without reasonable accommodation. Pre-employment drug testing is required for safety sensitive positions or as may otherwise be required by contract or law. Due to the high volume of responses, we will only be able to respond to candidates of interest. All candidates must have valid authorization to work in the U.S. Thank you for your interest in Panasonic Corporation of North America.  

  

**WE TAKE OPPORTUNITY SERIOUSLY:**  

  

Panasonic prioritizes total wellbeing. We offer a wide variety of benefits and programs to support your physical, emotional, financial, social and environmental health.  

  

The salary range of $130,000- $140,000 is just one component of Panasonic’s total package. Actual compensation varies depending on the individual’s knowledge, skills, experience, and location. This role may be eligible for discretionary bonuses and incentives.

title: Lead Payroll Analyst
description:
Overview:
Panasonic Lead Payroll Analyst
Every moment of every day, people all over the world turn to Panasonic to make their lives simpler, more enjoyable, more productive and more secure. Since our founding almost a century ago, we’ve been committed to improving peoples’ lives and making the world a better place–one customer, one business, one innovative leap at a time. Come join our journey.  


Responsibilities:  

  

Click here to learn more about how Panasonic is creating a better life, a better world.  

  

Watch this video to see how our employees are shaping the technologies that move us. **What You'll Get To Do:**


While ensuring a high level of customer service and satisfaction, the Lead Payroll Analyst role will have responsibility for ensuring all payrolls required for Panasonic Corporation of North America Shared Service are processed, audited and delivered to employees on a timely and accurate basis. Responsibilities will also include compliance, analysis, and reconciliation of payroll our Canadian Payrolls and be a backfill on parts of the US payroll processing. Currently, we are using Workday for US Payroll Processing and Time and Attendance and 2 ADP Platforms for the Canada Payrolls.


Payroll Processing

* Analyze and resolve payroll issues related to tax, general accounting, regulatory requirements, benefits, time reporting, and labor agreement matters.
* Proactively assess needs of the payroll department. Identify, analyze, and recommend business processes, and system enhancements for continuous improvement of the payroll process.
* Develop, run, and review audit reports to ensure accuracy of payroll data.
* Process manual checks, voids, stop pays, direct deposit reversals, and payroll adjustments as necessary.
* Ensure payroll systems and processes are appropriately set up to remain compliant with country and province regulatory legislation related to payroll.
* Develop and maintain payroll related content for Employee Services Knowledge Base.
* Perform testing support of payroll system patches and upgrades.
* Assist Sr Payroll Manager and Payroll Manager with research and compliance of Canada. regulations pertaining to labor and tax laws affecting employee paychecks.
* Document and update departmental policies and procedures as needed.
* Perform various audits and review schedules of employee data.
* Payroll processing and Time and Attendance for multiple companies in 2 ADP Payroll systems for hourly and salaried employees in Canada.
* Work with third party vendors to ensure payrolls are accurately completed per payroll schedules for Panasonic employees in Canada.
* Coordinate closely with accounting teams.


Communications and Customer Support

* Train HR Services team on payroll processing and time and attendance processes and updates to ensure 80 percent first call resolutions.
* Conduct User Training to HR when needed.
* Serve as Tier 2 Payroll support within HR Service model, addressing and resolving employee issues and questions related to pay while ensuring a high level of customer service and satisfaction.
* Meet service level agreements, SLAs, to ensure we are providing a high level of customer service while maintaining and building strong relationships.


Scope* Individual Contributor, no direct reports
* Reports to Sr Payroll Manager

**What You'll bring:**


Education and Experience

* Bachelor’s degree in related field, or equivalent education and experience.
* Minimum 5 years' experience supporting time and payroll systems in a large corporate environment.
* Working knowledge of Canada. wage and hour, garnishments and payroll taxes rules at the federal and provincial levels.
* Experience with Workday HCM, Payroll, Time Tracking preferred as well as ADP WorkforceNow.
* American Payroll Association training, CPP certification an advantage.


Competencies

* Demonstrate good judgment and discretion in handling confidential information.
* Ability to analyze complex payroll situations and make recommendations.
* Excellent problem solving skills.
* Detail oriented and strong organization skills.
* Proficiency with MS Office applications, payroll software, and report writing.
* Self starter with the ability to work with minimal supervision in a team environment.
* Ability to work with individuals at all levels within and outside the company.
* Good time management skills in order to meet continuous critical deadlines.


Communications

* Exceptional oral and written communication skills and above average administrative skills.


**What We Offer:*** Competitive compensation package

* Employee Referral Program
* Educational Assistance

* Review contractual obligations; identifying risks and problems and proposing solutions; and reporting to the Legal and Compliance and business stakeholders.
