* Leverage technology including contract lifecycle management (CLM) platforms, dashboards and information databases to support sales.
* Collect and manage materials to be uploaded into a Document Repository using CLM platform.
* Use tools for project tracking and status.


Communicate and collaborate with business stakeholders to ensure effective, timely order administration, and support compliance initiatives:

* Proactively work with other internal stakeholders to support the development of processes for contract and order review to comply with government and public sector flow downs and update those processes as necessary to ensure continued compliance.


General Administration

* Assist with drafting and updating departmental process diagrams, operating procedures and ad hoc status reports as required.
* Provide scheduling and calendar administration as requested.

**What You'll Bring**


Education and Experience

* Bachelor’s degree & 7+ years work experience . Preferred Master or Juris Doctorate degree.
* 4+ years experience with state procurement contracts.
* Knowledge of state procurement and contract management requirements, regulations, and best practices.
* Understanding of governance processes.
* Experience maintaining accurate information in a computerized maintenance management system database to track, monitor and assess contract and project performance.
* Knowledge of Federal Acquisition Regulation (FAR) and Defense Federal Acquisition Regulation Supplement (DFARS) is a plus.
* Proficient in MS 365, as well as project management and/or contract management platforms. Expert Experience with Excel (such as creating macros, using pivot tables, and creating dashboards).
* Preferred experience in Six Sigma or Lean Principles.
* Preferred experience with technical writing (standard operating procedures, policy documents) .
* Experience managing multiple projects simultaneously.


Competencies

* Ability to work independently with minimum supervision, shift focus, adapt to changing priorities, maintain patience in high pressure situations and take initiative where appropriate.
* Attention to detail and the ability to spot errors and inconsistencies.
* Ability to work with a team at all levels of an organization.
* Prioritizes tasks in a fast paced, changing environment through frequent interruptions and changing deadlines.
* Organizes information or materials for others.
* Adaptable and willingness to support new tasks.


Communications

* Excellent reading and language comprehension.
* Able to clearly and accurately explain issues, policies, procedures and other pertinent information to clients and co-workers.
* Able to relay and redirect complete and accurate messages to appropriate persons and departments.


**What We Offer:*** Competitive compensation package
* Comprehensive benefits
* Pet Insurance
* Paid Parental Care Leave
* Employee Referral Program
* Educational Assistance
* Flexible Work Program
* Volunteer time Off
* Casual Dress Code
* Total Well Being Program


Panasonic is proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender identity, sex, sexual orientation, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, and any other characteristic protected by law or company policy. All qualified individuals are required to perform the essential functions of the job with or without reasonable accommodation. Pre-employment drug testing is required for safety sensitive positions or as may otherwise be required by contract or law. Due to the high volume of responses, we will only be able to respond to candidates of interest. All candidates must have valid authorization to work in the U.S. Thank you for your interest in Panasonic Corporation of North America.
**WE TAKE OPPORTUNITY SERIOUSLY:**  

  

Panasonic prioritizes total wellbeing. We offer a wide variety of benefits and programs to support your physical, emotional, financial, social and environmental health.  

**The salary range of $105k - $115k is just one component of Panasonic’s total package.** Actual compensation varies depending on the individual’s knowledge, skills, experience, and location. This role may be eligible for discretionary bonuses and incentives.

title: Operating Room Assistant
description:
Overview:

Operating Room Assistant (ORA) functions as a member of the Perioperative Service team under the direct supervision of a RN. Responsible for transporting patients from their rooms to surgery, from one area to another within the department of surgical services and the hospital. Responsible for assisting in general cleaning and room turnover, running errands, relaying messages, and assisting with basic patient care.
Responsibilities:
* Correctly identifies patients and safely transports them to and from the operating room, holding area, or post anesthesia care area.
* Helps turnover OR suites.
* Assists in positioning, lifting and transferring patients as directed.
* Assists with case set up for assigned rooms.
* Cleans designated supply areas and adheres to Infection Control and departmental guideline in doing so.
* Cleans designated equipment in area assigned and adheres to guidelines.
* Assists with general upkeep of area to provide safe, clean, organized environment.
* Performs between case clean-up of anesthesia equipment and maintains changing circuits and tubing.
* Communicates with Sterile Processing to obtain supplies as needed.
* Obtains necessary equipment, supplies and positioning aides for cases.
* Restocks sterile supplies in OR storage areas and OR rooms as needed.
* Returns clean equipment to equipment storage area.
* Checks and stocks solutions, rotating inventory as needed.
* Orders and maintains adequate par levels for all anesthesia supplies and equipment.
* Completes assignments in timely manner and utilizes time effectively.
* Reports equipment problems to appropriate person.
* Demonstrates proficiency in Autoclave use.
* Stocks anesthesia carts as directed.
* Stocks anesthesia closet/supply area as directed.
* Performs BI test/A test.
* Transport specimens, equipment or supplies utilizing appropriate and safe techniques.
* Retrieves blood from Blood Bank.
* Performs and documents temperature, humidity checks for OR room. Performs and documents temperature checks for refrigerator/freezer.
* Provides considerate respectful care focused upon the patients’ individual needs.
* Affirms the patient’s right to make decisions regarding his/her medical care, including the decision to discontinue treatment, to the extent permitted by law. Demonstrates an understanding of the range of care needed based on the age of the patients cared for.
* Demonstrates knowledge of growth, development and/or adult health throughout the life span as appropriate to the job performed.


Qualifications:
* High school diploma or equivalent required.
* One-year clinical experience in accredited hospital with OR experience preferred.
* BLS certification required.
* Ability to understand the operation of some equipment and machinery and ability function independently. Strong professional, organizational, and interpersonal skills to effectively relate with all members of the healthcare team.


About Us:

CentraState Healthcare System, a partner of Atlantic Health System, is a fully accredited, not-for-profit, community-based health system that provides comprehensive health services in the central New Jersey region. In addition to offering a full range of leading-edge diagnostic and treatment options, CentraState serves as a valuable health partner focused on the latest ways to prevent disease, promote healthy behaviors, and help people of all ages live life well. Based in Freehold, CentraState is comprised of a 284-bed acute-care hospital, a vibrant health and wellness campus, three award-winning senior living communities, a charitable foundation, and convenient satellite health pavilions offering primary care and specialty physician practices, along with access to outpatient services, such as lab and physical therapy. The system also offers a family medicine residency and geriatric fellowship training program in affiliation with Rutgers Robert Wood Johnson Medical School. Among its many honors and accreditations, CentraState is one of less than two percent of hospitals nationwide to earn Magnet® designation for nursing excellence four times and was designated a Great Place to Work-Certified™ Company by Great Place to Work® for the second consecutive year.  

When you bring your talent to CentraState, you are joining a trailblazing healthcare facility, committed to providing high-quality, patient-focused care. Join us in making incredible strides in health care, and making a difference in our community. We believe in enriching the lives of our employees through work/life balance initiatives, tuition assistance, career advancement opportunities and much more.  

Find out why our employees love their jobs and being part of the CentraState family!  

What We Offer:
* Highly competitive compensation
* Excellent benefits package and rewards program
* 403(b) retirement plan with company match
* 401(a) retirement plan with employer contribution
* Life Insurance
* Tuition Reimbursement Program
* Profit Sharing Program
* Growth Opportunity and Workforce Development Initiatives
* Continuing Education / Onsite Training
* A warm, welcoming company culture based upon mutual respect and a collaborative goal of providing excellent patient care
* Concierge Services with Work & Family Benefits
* Magnet recognized healthcare facility
company_description: CentraState Healthcare System, a partner of Atlantic Health System, is a fully accredited, not-for-profit, community-based health system that provides comprehensive health services in central NJ

title: Registered Dietitian-PT-Day
description:
Overview:

“Our team members are the heart of what makes us better. At Hackensack Meridian Health we help our patients live better, healthier lives — and we help one another to succeed. The Registered Dietician develops, implements and promotes quality, evidence based nutrition care to meet the needs of the patients in the acute care setting and in the out-patient setting as assigned. Supports community events to promote health and improve the nutrition status of the communities served by Hackensack Meridian Health.
Responsibilities:
* Utilizes the Nutrition Care Process (NCP) to develop, implement, and monitor evidence based medical nutrition therapy interventions for patients as assigned.
* Obtains appropriate data, analyzes and interprets data utilizing evidence based guidelines, develops and implements evidence-based nutrition interventions and care plans, and monitors the progress of nutrition interventions by evaluating patient outcomes.
* Provides nutrition education and/or counseling as appropriate.
* Actively participates as a member of the health care team caring for the patient.

title: AI Research Scientist, Language - Generative AI
description:
Meta is seeking a Research Scientist to join our Llama Large Language Model (LLM) Research team. We are looking for recognized experts in NLP or reinforcement learning; with experience in areas like LLM alignment; multilingual modeling; code generation; responsible AI; and model controllability. The ideal candidate will have an interest in producing and applying new science to help us develop and responsibly release large language models.  

  

  

### **AI Research Scientist, Language - Generative AI Responsibilities:**

* Lead, collaborate, and execute on research that pushes forward the state of the art in large language model research.
* Directly contribute to experiments, including designing experimental details, writing reusable code, running evaluations, and organizing results.
* Work with a large and globally distributed team.
* Contribute to publications and open-sourcing efforts.
* Help identify long-term ambitious research goals as well as intermediate milestones.
* Prioritize research that can be applied to Meta's product development.
* Mentor other team members. Play a significant role in healthy cross-functional collaboration.

  

  

  

### **Minimum Qualifications:**

* Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, relevant technical field, or equivalent practical experience.
* A PhD in AI, computer science, or related technical fields.
* Experience holding an industry, faculty, or government researcher position.
* Publications in machine learning.
* Experience writing software and executing complex experiments involving large AI models and datasets.
* Must obtain work authorization in the country of employment at the time of hire, and maintain ongoing work authorization during employment.

  

  

  

### **Preferred Qualifications:**

* Direct experience in generative AI and LLM research.
* 2+ year(s) of work experience in a university, industry, or government lab, in a role with primary emphasis on AI research.
* First author publications experience at peer-reviewed AI conferences (e.g., NeurIPS, CVPR, ICML, ICLR, ICCV, and ACL).
* Experience developing and debugging in Python.

  

  

  

### **About Meta:**


Meta builds technologies that help people connect, find communities, and grow businesses. When Facebook launched in 2004, it changed the way people connect. Apps like Messenger, Instagram and WhatsApp further empowered billions around the world. Now, Meta is moving beyond 2D screens toward immersive experiences like augmented and virtual reality to help build the next evolution in social technology. People who choose to build their careers by building with us at Meta help shape a future that will take us beyond what digital connection makes possible today—beyond the constraints of screens, the limits of distance, and even the rules of physics.  

  

  

Meta is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, transgender status, sexual stereotypes, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics. We also consider qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with applicable federal, state and local law. Meta participates in the E-Verify program in certain locations, as required by law. Please note that Meta may leverage artificial intelligence and machine learning technologies in connection with applications for employment.
  

  

Meta is committed to providing reasonable accommodations for candidates with disabilities in our recruiting process. If you need any assistance or accommodations due to a disability, please let us know at accommodations-ext@fb.com.  

  

$143,000/year to $208,000/year + bonus + equity + benefits  

  

Individual compensation is determined by skills, qualifications, experience, and location. Compensation details listed in this posting reflect the base hourly rate, monthly rate, or annual salary only, and do not include bonus, equity or sales incentives, if applicable. In addition to base compensation, Meta offers benefits. Learn more about benefits at Meta.

title: Teacher (2 positions available)
description:
**Position Details**
--------------------


Position Information
**About Hofstra**
Hofstra University is nationally ranked and recognized as Long Island’s largest private university located in Hempstead, N.Y. When you work at Hofstra, you join a team of talented professionals committed to preparing students for the challenges of tomorrow, in an environment that cultivates learning through the free and open exchange of ideas for the betterment of humankind. The work we do at Hofstra supports the education and well-being of our students, and the workforce of the future. While working towards this mission, employees can take advantage of many enriching experiences on campus. Whether it’s a lunchtime lecture, a Division I NCAA athletics game, a musical concert, a theatre performance, or a visit to one of our two accredited museums, there is always something exciting to do at Hofstra. Enjoy the ease of going to the fitness center, taking a swim, or grabbing a bite to eat without having to leave our beautiful campus! Hofstra University is dedicated to recruiting and retaining a highly qualified and diverse academic community of students, faculty, staff, and administrators respectful of the contributions and dignity of each of its members. We especially encourage women, people of color, members of the LGBTQ+ community, veterans, and people with disabilities to apply.
  

**Position Title** Teacher (2 positions available)
  

**Position Number** 899854, 898887
  

**School/Division** School of Education
  

**Department**
  

**Full-Time or Part-Time** Full-Time
  

**Description**
Reporting to the Director of the Child Care Institute, the Teacher is responsible for providing a warm, nurturing classroom environment for children and a welcoming environment for parents and families. The teacher sets the standard of professionalism within the classroom, directing other team members in following the curriculum, procedures and schedule set forth by the administration of the center.  

  

Responsibilities include, but are not limited to:* Creates and maintains a classroom portfolio and an individual child portfolio for each child in the group.
* Observes and assesses the children on a continual basis.
* Plans activities that are age appropriate, engaging and challenging.
* Creates and maintains open communication with parents and families and in the overall smooth operation of the classroom/center.
* Assists in carrying out the mission of the both the Child Care Institute and Hofstra University.
* Performs other related duties as assigned.

  

**Qualifications**
* Bachelor’s degree required.
* At least 2 years prior experience working with young children in a New York State Office of Children and Family Serviced (NYSOCFS) licensed program.


  

**Preferred Qualifications**
* Bachelor’s degree in Early Childhood Education or Elementary Education with an Early Childhood Education component/specialization preferred.
* Pursuit of a Master’s degree in Early Childhood Education a plus.
* Experience working in a National Association for the Education of the Young Children (NAEYC) Accredited childcare center.
* Demonstrates knowledge of the NAEC Accreditation Standards, NAEYC Accreditation process and Teaching Strategies Creative Curriculum.
* Work experience with infants and toddlers.


  

**Special Instructions**
  

**Deadline** Open Until Filled
  

**Date Posted** 05/10/2024
  

**EEO Statement**
Hofstra University is an equal opportunity employer, committed to fostering diversity in its faculty, administrative staff and student body, and encourages applications from the entire spectrum of a diverse community.
  

**Salary/Salary Range** $31,667
  

Additional Information
*Hofstra University provides the above salary\\* as a good faith estimate of the starting pay range which considers factors such as (but not limited to) scope and responsibilities of the position, candidate's work experience and education. In addition to the salary offered, we offer a collegial and inclusive culture, and a benefits program which includes generous paid time off, paid holidays, tuition remission for employees and eligible dependents, and a retirement plan with University contributions.*  

  

* *Salary ranges indicated for positions covered under a Collective Bargaining Agreement are in accordance with the CBA.*

title: Director of Security
description:
The Garden City Hotel features timeless elegance with modern-day comforts. The property showcases renovated guest rooms along with luxurious suites, first-class culinary backed by Celebrity Chef David Burke, and an array of banquet halls. Our property boasts Red Salt Room, King Bar, The Rose Room Underground Lounge and The Patio Bar, all inspired by Chef David Burke. Located in the heart of Garden City, the Hotel is a stone’s throw away from Manhattan, only 15 miles by car or 45 minutes by Long Island Railroad.


We pride ourselves on our meticulous attention to detail and relentless drive towards success. We are looking for a Hospitality Professional to help us reinforce the standards that historically make us one of the best in the business.


We are currently recruiting for an experienced **Hotel Director of Security**.


Responsibilities include, but are not limited to:

* Supervise Security Officers and Supervisors, including scheduling according to hotel business levels, and daily work assignments
* Manage daily administrative responsibilities of the Security Department
* Maintain complete knowledge of hotel activities, including:


1) Layout of building and surrounding grounds


2) Fire and emergency plans


3) Outlets and hours of operation


4) All hotel services and facilities


5) House count and scheduled groups


6) Scheduled activities and functions within the hotel


7) Hotel rules of conduct

* Manage fire alarms and all emergencies on hotel property. Point of contact during emergencies with all local municipalities.
* Work with Nassau County Fire Marshall for annual inspection, generator tests, and equipment maintenance to meet codes
* Fire Safety and Emergency Procedures training at new hire orientation classes, as well as on-going training throughout all departments.
* Supervise Incident Reporting process, ensuring all guest and employee incident reports are completed accurately. Report incidents to appropriate Department Managers and General Manager.
* Point of contact for all guest related incidents and accidents.
* Chair the hotel’s Safety Committee.
* Maintenance and supervision of hotel fire panel system, security cameras, Saflok system, and hotel radios.
* Maintain Lost & Found process for all valuable items.
* Maintain positive guest and employee relations at all times.
* Maintain working relationship with all departments to enforce security and safety standards and procedures.


Requirements:

* Hotel Security management experience
* NYS Security License
* Valid NYS Drivers License; able to drive hotel vehicles when needed
* Excellent interpersonal communication skills, written and verbal
* Computer literate – MSOffice, Opera, Saflok
* Must be able to stand or sit for extended periods of time
* Must be able to move or lift large/heavy objects, some in excess of 100 lbs.
* CPR/First Aid/AED Certification a plus


We offer a full benefits package including:

* Group Health Plans for Medical, Dental, Vision
* Voluntary Life Insurance AND Company Paid Life Insurance
* Aflac Supplemental Short Term Disability, Accident Advantage and Cancer Care
* Long Term Disability
* 401k


You may also apply online at https://www.gardencity hotel.com/careers.

title: Assistant Teacher
description:
Join the teaching team at Imagine Early Learning Centers, an Employee Owned Company.



$500 Sign on Taxable Bonus Currently available for COVID. Paid after 3 months completion of satisfactory employment.



Full Covid-19 vaccination required



Imagine Early Learning Centers seeks an **Assistant Teacher at Imagine Early Learning Centers.** Our center is a safe, nurturing, fun and friendly environment.



We are seeking an experienced and creative professional looking to join a team providing the highest quality, educational childcare for working families. While you will primarily serve as an Assistant teacher and work in the classroom, this position will be a dual role and provides the opportunity to develop expertise in education administration.



Find out more about us at www.imagineelc.com.

**Responsibilities include:**


* Participate in planning and implementing developmentally appropriate curriculum
* Ensure compliance with licensing and NAEYC guidelines
* Effective communication with families, staff and board
* Effective written communication skills
* Ability to meet physical requirements of position which include lifting children, pushing strollers/buggies, sitting on the floor and year-round daily outdoor activities


**Qualifications:**


* CDA or Associates Degree in Early Childhood, Elementary, Special Education, preferred or in progress
* Previous experience teaching children in an Early Childhood program preferred
* Previous experience with NAEYC standards and the accreditation process a plus

#### **Competitive salaries and benefits including:**


* ESOP (Employee Stock Ownership Plan) qualified Retirement Benefit Plan. Eligible employees receive this retirement benefit, at no cost.
* Full-Time employees accrue 17 Vacation Days and 7 Sick Days annually
* Medical, Dental, and Vision coverage
* Prudential Life and AD&D Insurances - 1x annual salary, at no cost
* Commuter - Transit (Subway, Bus, Train, Parking)
* Voluntary Insurances: Short-Term Disability, Accident, Hospital
* Tuition Reimbursement/Degree Incentive Reward
* Educational Support programs available
* Wellness: Mental Health - 3 Therapy visits per year, at no cost.
* Childcare Discount where available
* Professional Development
* TicketsatWork


**Imagine is an Employee Owned Company**



In 2018 Imagine officially became an employee owned company through the creation of an ESOP (Employee Stock Ownership Plan). We value and support our ownership culture by offering to all qualified employees a retirement benefit without cost.


**Who We Are**



Imagine Early Learning Centers, an employee owned child care management company, operates twelve high quality, full day licensed and NAEYC accredited Early Childhood centers in the NY metro area for children 6 weeks to 5-years-old. With state of the art facilities, professional development opportunities for promotion, a teamwork approach to classroom and center management, and an innovative and rewarding work environment, Imagine maintains a satisfied and talented teacher staff. At Imagine, we know children, as well as staff and families, thrive in a stimulating and nurturing environment. Staff, children and families alike are valued as individuals and as members of our diverse community.


**Additional information**



Imagine Early Learning Centers is an equal opportunity employer and is committed to providing a workplace free from harassment and discrimination. We value a diverse, inclusive workforce and celebrate the unique differences of our employees. All qualified applicants for employment will be considered without regard to an individual’s race, color, sex, gender identity or expression, religion, age, national origin or ancestry, citizenship, disability, marital status, sexual orientation, military or veteran status, or any other basis protected by federal, state or local laws. If you are unable to submit your application because of incompatible assistive technology or a disability, please contact us at humanresources@imagineelc.com. Imagine will reasonably accommodate qualified individuals with disabilities to the extent required by applicable law.
